conclusion: Two parallel metal plates separated by distance d with a charged ball falling between them.
Initially, the ball falls vertically under gravity only (path AB).
After voltage application, the ball moves at a 45° angle (path BC).
The ball falls vertically along path AB between the plates.
When the ball falls along AB, only gravity is acting on it with force G downward.
No horizontal force acts on the ball since plates are uncharged.
The ball moves along path BC at a 45° angle after voltage application.
When the ball moves along BC, gravity acts downward with force G and electric force F_e acts horizontally.
For 45° motion, the horizontal and vertical components of the net force must be equal: F_e = G.
Electric force on a charged particle in a uniform electric field is F_e = qE.
Electric field between parallel plates with voltage U and separation d is E = U/d.
Since F_e = G, we have qE = G, leading to q * (U/d) = G.
Solving for q gives q = (G * d) / U.
The charge amount of the small ball is q = (G * d) / U.
